meanings.definition: Too old to be useful or effective.
meanings.sent1: The overaged computer struggled to load even simple programs.
meanings.sent2: The overaged building was in need of extensive repairs.
meanings.sent3: The overaged car groaned and sputtered like an old man trying to run a marathon.
meanings.sent4: Her overaged phone wheezed and lagged behind the newer models.
meanings.sent5: The overaged tree stood stooped and weary, its branches creaking with age.

meanings.sent1: The overaged student was a decade older than his classmates.
meanings.sent2: The overaged wine had a rich and complex flavor.
meanings.sent3: The overaged marathon runner surprised everyone by finishing first.
meanings.sent4: The overaged library contained rare books dating back centuries.
meanings.sent5: The overaged clock ticked slowly, its hands moving with deliberate slowness.
